Not raising the debt ceiling means we would be forced to only spend what comes in --- also known as a balanced budget. I could accept that.
Our debt now equals our entire economy.

I promised the voters of Kentucky to oppose deficits, to oppose budgets that don't balance, and to spend only what we have.
This a bipartisan busting of the budget caps that will further indenture the next generation.

I thank you for standing with me. Please read my entire statement here: http://randpaul.com/news/rand-pauls-statement-on-nsa-spying … #StandWithRand
I do not do this to obstruct.  I do it to build something better, more effective, more lasting, and more cognizant of who we are.
Fighting against unconditional, illegal powers that take away rights, taken by previous Congresses and administrations is just as important.
Sometimes when the problem is big enough, you just have to start over. The tax code and our regulatory burdens are two good examples.
I am ready and willing to start the debate on how we fight terrorism without giving up our liberty.

There has to be another way. We must find it together.

So tomorrow, I will force the expiration of the NSA illegal spy program.
But we do not need to give up who we are to defeat them. In fact, we must not.
I believe we must fight terrorism, and I believe we must stand strong against our enemies.
Let me be clear: I acknowledge the need for a robust intelligence agency and for a vigilant national security.
Tomorrow, we will come back with just hours left before the NSA illegal spying powers expire.
Then, last week, I further blocked the extension of these powers and the Senate adjourned for recess rather than stay and debate them.
I spoke for over 10 hours to call attention to the vast expansion of the spy state and the corresponding erosion of our liberties.
Seeing proponents of this illegal spying rushing toward a deadline to wholesale renew this unconstitutional power, I filibustered the bill.
It's why I have been seeking for months to have a full, open and honest debate on this issue-- a debate that never came.
That's why two years ago, I sued the NSA. It's why I proposed the Fourth Amendment Protection Act.
Forcing us to choose between our rights and our safety is a false choice and we are better than that as a nation and as a people.
The callous use of general warrants and the disregard for the Bill of Rights must end.
I have fought for several years now to end the illegal spying of the NSA on ordinary Americans.

And if war should prove unavoidable, America will fight with overwhelming force and we will not relent until victory is ours
The world should not mistake reluctance for inaction.
As commander in chief, the world will know that our objective is peace but the world will not to mistake our desire for peace for passivity
I will never take the country to war without just cause or without the Constitutional approval of Congress.
I vow to judge questions of war with a solemn and profound deliberation
I will never forget our veterans. I will never forget our soldiers in the field.
One thing I know is true: we owe a debt of gratitude to the men and women who fight for our Bill of Rights & no one should ever forget it.
War brings with it great obligations. These obligations don't end when our brave young men & women return from war.  It's the beginning.
The consequences are potentially ominous. That responsibility should never be given to anyone who frivolously and cavalierly calls for war
There is no greater responsibility for any legislator or any leader than to determine when we go to war.

I, for one, want to know what the Fed is doing.
Without fiscal restraint, you can't ever have monetary restraint.
Anytime a government tries to set prices, the consequence is disastrous.
No one, no matter how wise, can determine the "correct" price of bread without a marketplace.
At current interest rates, we pay about $237 billion in interest each year.
At $4 trillion, and roughly only $55 billion in equity, the Fed is leveraged about 77-to-1... An insane amount of leverage for any bank
Inflation nearly got the better of us in the 1970s and now debt threatens to do the same.
Now, the great American dollar that was once as good as gold, is backed by promises.
Transparency at the Fed would not hurt the Fed, but a complete lack of transparency continues to hurt and cheat the rest of us.
This month we learned that the Fed’s official balance is about to reach an astounding $4 trillion.http://bit.ly/1b2rLtT
It is more than time to part the curtain that hides the trillions of dollars that change hands.
My delayed speech on the fed starting now.
Senator Paul's flight to DC this afternoon was delayed, and it is not clear when he will be able to speak tonight. We will keep you updated.
You can thank the Fed for your grocery and gas bills spiraling out of control.
Congress has the power to coin and regulate money, so an audit of the Fed is the perfect way to conduct oversight.
While nearly 80% of Americans support a Federal Reserve audit, many of my colleagues would rather listen to DC’s “conventional wisdom”
Each and every one of us knows there will be a severe price to pay at some point for this kind of recklessness.
Even after helping create the financial crisis of '08 with its easy money policies, the Fed is still printing money like there's no tomorrow
The Fed's non-stop printing press crashed the economy and buried it under the rubble of endless bailouts and a devalued currency.
I can't understand how any politician could go home to face the voters after denying them the chance to hold the Fed accountable.
The Fed’s policies hurt the poor and middle class the most by boosting the costs of goods and services.
The Fed's endless cycle of print-now, ask-questions later drove the economy into a ditch and is preventing any chance of real recovery.
Follow me here throughout the day for more on the Fed.
I will speak on the Senate floor this afternoon in opposition to the nomination of Janet Yellen to the Federal Reserve.
I am going to demand the administration and the NSA follow the constitution and protect Americans' 4th Amendment rights.
I want hundreds of thousands of Americans to Stand with me against the NSA violating your rights.

Last night, I had the privilege of speaking at the @NHGOP dinner. Click here to watch my entire speech:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7r6iR5AQPkg … #TCOT
If there is anyone to blame here it is not Apple, it is Congress and the tax code it created.
I will do everything in my power to make our tax code simpler. I will not be a party to witch hunts that mistake cause for effect.
To the Apple executives here, I apologize for this theater of the absurd.
Apple has done more to enrich people's lives than politicians will ever do.
Money goes where it is welcome. If you want more money to be earned in the United States, make profit welcome here.
Instead of doing the right thing we drag businessmen and women in here to berate them for trying to maximize their profits for shareholders.
Today we could vote to lower the corporate income tax but we won't. Today we could vote to let profits come home at 5% but we won't.
To US Senate: I say, instead of Apple executives, you should have brought in a giant mirror if you want to see who is responsible.
I am offended by the spectacle of dragging in here executives from Apple using the brute force of government to bully a great success story.
I am offended by a $4 trillion government bullying, berating and badgering one of America's greatest success stories.
Instead of examining our broken tax system, the US Senate is about to harass Apple-one of the greatest business success stories in history.
